meanings.definition: To clean or polish (something) by rubbing or brushing.
meanings.sent1: I will furbish my shoes before the party.
meanings.sent2: She furbished the silverware until it sparkled.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to furbish its fur with its tongue.
meanings.sent4: The sun furbished the sky with vibrant colors at sunset.
meanings.sent5: The artist furbished the canvas with bold strokes of paint.

meanings.definition: To give a fresh look to (something) by renovating or redecorating.
meanings.sent1: We decided to furbish the old house with new furniture.
meanings.sent2: The interior designer furbished the room with modern decor.
meanings.sent3: The elves furbished Santa's workshop just in time for Christmas.
meanings.sent4: Her smile furbished the room with warmth and joy.
meanings.sent5: The gardener furbished the garden with colorful flowers.

meanings.definition: To make something look brighter or more attractive.
meanings.sent1: The sunlight furbished the room with a golden glow.
meanings.sent2: She furbished her outfit with a sparkling necklace.
meanings.sent3: The magician furbished his hat with a rabbit.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter furbished the dull room with happiness.
meanings.sent5: The rainbow furbished the sky with its vibrant colors.
